docs.summary: Manage marketing consents

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

params.name: info
params.doc: List of marketing consent information to update or create.

docs.summary:
Creates or updates multiple marketing consents.

Note that `info.lastConfirmationActivity` is required unless the `state` is `REVOKED` or `NEVER_CONFIRMED`.

>**Note:** For existing marketing consents with `{"type": "EMAIL"}`, you can't update the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Trying to do so maintains the current state. However, you can create a new marketing consent and set the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Note that you can't create more than a single consent per email or phone number.

examples.title: Bulk Upsert Marketing Consent

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

docs.summary:
Creates a confirmed marketing consent.

Creates a marketing consent with a `state` of `CONFIRMED`, regardless of what state you set it to. To create a marketing consent with a different state, use [Upsert Marketing Consent](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/marketing/marketing-consent/upsert-marketing-consent), or [Bulk Upsert Marketing Consent](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/marketing/marketing-consent/bulk-upsert-marketing-consent).

permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

docs.summary: Deletes a marketing consent.

docs.summary: Retrieves a marketing consent.

permissions.name: Read Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to view marketing consents.

params.name: type
params.doc: The communication channel of the marketing consent.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a marketing consent by its details.

>**Note:** Due to the ongoing development of our new documentation portal, the query parameter is not displaying as expected. Use the `details` object located in the [marketing consent object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/marketing/marketing-consent/marketing-consent-object) in the request. You can also see the code example for reference.

examples.title: Get a marketing consent by its communication details

permissions.name: Read Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to view marketing consents.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of marketing consents, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting. Up to 100 marketing consents can be returned per request.

The default `sort` is `id` in `ASC` order. For a detailed list of supported operations, see [filtering and sorting for marketing consent properties](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/marketing/marketing-consent/sort-and-filter). To learn how to query marketing consents, see [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).

examples.title: Query Marketing Consent

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

docs.summary:
Removes a marketing consent by its communication details.

Removing a marketing consent cancels the consent, and updates the `state` to `REVOKED`. The marketing consent still exists, but the recipient of the marketing consent is no longer eligible to receive commmunication. To delete a marketing consent entirely, use [Delete Marketing Consent](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/marketing-consent/delete-marketing-consent).

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

params.name: mask
params.doc: Explicit list of fields to update

docs.summary:
Updates a marketing consent's properties. 

Only fields provided in `mask.paths` are updated. You can update the following fields:

+ `state`
+ `lastConfirmationActivity` 
+ `extendedFields`

Each time the marketing consent is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

>**Note:** For existing marketing consents with `{"type": "EMAIL"}`, you can't update the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Trying to do so maintains the current state. However, you can create a new marketing consent and set the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Note that you can't create more than a single consent per email or phone number.

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

params.name: marketingConsent
params.doc: Marketing consent to create or update.

docs.summary:
Creates or updates a marketing consent.

Note that `marketingConsent.lastConfirmationActivity` is required unless the `state` is `REVOKED` or `NEVER_CONFIRMED`.

>**Note:** For existing marketing consents with `{"type": "EMAIL"}`, you can't update the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Trying to do so maintains the current state. However, you can create a new marketing consent and set the `state` to `UNKNOWN_STATE`. Note that you can't create more than a single consent per email or phone number.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type struct

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: id
members.doc: Marketing consent ID.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number.

members.name: details
members.doc: Marketing consent communication details.

members.name: state
members.doc:
Marketing consent state. 

+ `UNKNOWN_STATE`: State of the marketing consent is unknown.
+ `NEVER_CONFIRMED`: The visitor never confirmed to receive marketing consents.
+ `REVOKED`: The marketing consent has been removed, for example, when a visitor unsubscribes from a newsletter. 
+ `PENDING`: The marketing consent is pending confirmation. Relevant only for `{"optInLevel": "DOUBLE_CONFIRMATION"}`.
+ `CONFIRMED`: The site visitor has confirmed their marketing consent.

Default: `UNKNOWN_STATE`.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the marketing consent was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the marketing consent was updated.

members.name: lastConfirmationActivity
members.doc: Last confirmation activity of the marketing consent.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Additional fields.

members.name: type
members.doc: The communication channel of the marketing consent.

members.name: identifier
members.doc:
Supported values:
+ `email`: Email address used for the marketing consent.
+ `phone`: Phone number in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format used for the SMS marketing consent.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address used for the marketing consent.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format used for the SMS marketing consent.

members.name: source
members.doc: Source of the given consent (how the visitor signed up).

members.name: description
members.doc: Consent description.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the consent was updated.

members.name: optInLevel
members.doc: Consent opt in level, either single or double confirmation.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

+ `phone`: Phone number in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format used for the SMS marketing consent.

messages.name: _wix_marketing_v1_BulkUpsertMarketingConsentResult
messages.displayName: Bulk Upsert Marketing Consent Result Object

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Position of the newly created or updated marketing consent in the array.

members.name: marketingConsent
members.doc: Newly created or updated marketing consent.

members.name: error
members.doc: Information about the error. Only returns if the action fails.

members.name: link
members.doc: Marketing consent confirmation or cancelation link.

members.name: granted
members.doc: Whether the recipient of the marketing consent is eligible to receive marketing messages. For example, if a visitor cancels their marketing consent, `CommunicationEligibility.granted` is `false`. Note that this only serves as a signal for your app to decide whether or not it should send marketing messages to the recipient's email address or phone number.

members.name: revokeConfirmationLink
members.doc: Cancellation link.

members.name: reason
members.doc: The reason the recipient of the marketing consent isn't eligible to receive marketing messages, for example, if the visitor unsubscribed from a newsletter.

members.name: type
members.doc: Link type.

members.name: url
members.doc: The link's URL.

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

messages.name: _wix_marketing_v1_MarketingConsentDetailsIdentifierType
messages.displayName: Marketing Consent Details Identifier Type Object

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_TYPE
  • EMAIL
  • PHONE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATE
  • NEVER_CONFIRMED
  • REVOKED
  • PENDING
  • CONFIRMED

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_OPT_IN_LEVEL
  • SINGLE_CONFIRMATION
  • DOUBLE_CONFIRMATION

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SOURCE
  • IN_PERSON
  • FORM
  • LINK_CONFIRMATION
  • EMAIL_SERVICE
  • OTHER
  • WIX_USERS

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_LINK_TYPE
  • CONFIRMATION
  • REVOKE_CONFIRMATION
